required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Determine the Relief of Dry Eye Symptoms With the Use of TheraTears® Products (DUNLIN)
clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Determine the Relief of Dry Eye Symptoms With the Use of TheraTears® Products

brief_summary.textblock: Dry eye is a very common condition that most often affects women and the elderly, and can be caused when the eyes do not produce enough tears, or when the tears evaporate too quickly. Although there isn't a simple cure for dry eye, there are numerous products on the market that attempt to help relieve some of the discomfort caused by this condition. Some of these products include artificial tears, omega-3 supplements, and/or anti-inflammatory medications. The purpose of this study is to evaluate the performance of a combination of TheraTears® products, and to compare them with the product(s) you have been using.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Change over time of OSDI score
primary_outcome.time_frame: At screening, 2 weeks, 1 month and 3 months
primary_outcome.description: Ocular Surface Disease Index (OSDI) questionnaire score

primary_outcome.measure: Change over time of Visual analogue scores
primary_outcome.time_frame: At screening, 2 weeks, 1 month and 3 months

primary_outcome.measure: Change over time of Tear osmolarity
Change over time of Tear film breakup time
Change over time of Corneal staining

secondary_outcome.measure: Change over time of Lid wiper epitheliopathy
Change over time of Meibomian gland expressibility
Change over time of Meibum quality
Change over time of Tear film lipid layer thickness
Change over time of Tear meniscus height
Change over time of Schirmer's I scores

arm_group.description: Participants randomized to the control group will be allowed to continue using their habitual artificial tears, and / or additional habitual concurrent dry eye treatments.

Participants in the study treatment group will receive all four products: TheraTears® Lubricant Eye Drop (15mL) - Dosage: Ophthalmic, 1 or 2 drops, prn TheraTears® preservative-free single-use containers (32-pack, 0.6mL each) - Dosage: Ophthalmic, 1 or 2 drops, prn TheraTears® Nutrition (90 pack) - Dosage: Oral, 3 capsules QD TheraTears® TheraLid® Eyelid Cleanser (48mL) - Dosage: Ophthalmic, 1 or 2 application OU, QD

facility.name: Centre for Contact Lens Research, University of Waterloo School of Optometry & Vision Science
